shortcv.p: Mr. Ioannis Sideris is a Research Officer at the Athens University of Economics and Business in ELTRUN (the e-Business Center) and a PhD external student at the Surrey University. He holds a first degree in Business Administration from the Athens University of Economics and Business and an MSc. in Information Systems Development from the London School of Economics. His research interests involved e-commerce and the role of intermediaries in the electronic marketplace.

From 2000 to 2001, after he completed his military services, he worked as a consultant at PricewaterhouseCoopers. He was the IT Manager for the designing, installation and operation of a Quality Measurement System for the Hellenic Post Office. Also, during the same period he worked as Human Resource Assistant Manager. Since February 2001 he has been working as a Research Associate in ELTRUN, and since November 2001 he has been a PhD student at the Surrey University.

His research focuses on strategic planning in the context of developing a Scenario Planning Methodology for high-tech markets with applications to Mobile Commerce. He has been involved in the MobiCom (IST Project), which has developed scenarios of the evolution of m-commerce. He was responsible for the research on Scenario Planning Methodology in order to explore the evolution of market structures and dynamics, key players, technology architectures, consumer behaviour, new products and services.
